message_1: Given the elliptic curve  $y^2 \equiv x^3 + 5x + 2\pmod{17}$ and a base point $P = (2,7)$, find the coordinates of the point $Q = 5P$.
message_2:
To find the coordinates of the point Q = 5P, we first need to compute the points 2P, 3P, and 4P using the point addition and point doubling formulas for elliptic curves.

Point Doubling:
Given a point P = (x1, y1), the point 2P = (x2, y2) can be computed using the following formulas:
λ = (3x1^2 + a) / 2y1 (mod p)
x2 = λ^2 - 2x1 (mod p)
y2 = λ(x1 - x2) - y1 (mod p)

Point Addition:
Given two points P1 = (x1, y1) and P2 = (x2, y2), the point P3 = P1 + P2 = (x3, y3) can be computed using the following formulas:
λ = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1) (mod p)
x3 = λ^2 - x1 - x2 (mod p)
y3 = λ(x1 - x3) - y1 (mod p)

Now, let's compute the points:

1. Compute 2P:
P = (2, 7), a = 5, p = 17

λ = (3(2)^2 + 5) / 2(7) (mod 17)
λ = (12 + 5) / 14 (mod 17)
λ = 17 / 14 (mod 17)
λ = 14^(-1) * 17 (mod 17)
λ = 4 * 17 (mod 17)
λ = 68 (mod 17)
λ = 0

x2 = λ^2 - 2x1 (mod 17)
x2 = 0^2 - 2(2) (mod 17)
x2 = -4 (mod 17)
x2 = 13

y2 = λ(x1 - x2) - y1 (mod 17)
y2 = 0(2 - 13) - 7 (mod 17)
y2 = -7 (mod 17)
y2 = 10

So, 2P = (13, 10)

2. Compute 3P = P + 2P:
P1 = (2, 7), P2 = (13, 10), p = 17

λ = (10 - 7) / (13 - 2) (mod 17)
λ = 3 / 11 (mod 17)
λ = 11^(-1) * 3 (mod 17)
λ = 12 * 3 (mod 17)
λ = 36 (mod 17)
λ = 2

x3 = λ^2 - x1 - x2 (mod 17)
x3 = 2^2 - 2 - 13 (mod 17)
x3 = 4 - 15 (mod 17)
x3 = -11 (mod 17)
x3 = 6

y3 = λ(x1 - x3) - y1 (mod 17)
y3 = 2(2 - 6) - 7 (mod 17)
y3 = -8 - 7 (mod 17)
y3 = -15 (mod 17)
y3 = 2

So, 3P = (6, 2)

3. Compute 4P = 2P + 2P:
P1 = (13, 10), P2 = (13, 10), a = 5, p = 17

λ = (3(13)^2 + 5) / 2(10) (mod 17)
λ = (507 + 5) / 20 (mod 17)
λ = 512 / 20 (mod 17)
λ = 20^(-1) * 512 (mod 17)
λ = 3 * 512 (mod 17)
λ = 1536 (mod 17)
λ = 1

x4 = λ^2 - 2x1 (mod 17)
x4 = 1^2 - 2(13) (mod 17)
x4 = 1 - 26 (mod 17)
x4 = -25 (mod 17)
x4 = 9

y4 = λ(x1 - x4) - y1 (mod 17)
y4 = 1(13 - 9) - 10 (mod 17)
y4 = 4 - 10 (mod 17)
y4 = -6 (mod 17)
y4 = 11

So, 4P = (9, 11)

4. Compute 5P = P + 4P:
P1 = (2, 7), P2 = (9, 11), p = 17

λ = (11 - 7) / (9 - 2) (mod 17)
λ = 4 / 7 (mod 17)
λ = 7^(-1) * 4 (mod 17)
λ = 5 * 4 (mod 17)
λ = 20 (mod 17)
λ = 3

x5 = λ^2 - x1 - x2 (mod 17)
x5 = 3^2 - 2 - 9 (mod 17)
x5 = 9 - 11 (mod 17)
x5 = -2 (mod 17)
x5 = 15

y5 = λ(x1 - x5) - y1 (mod 17)
y5 = 3(2 - 15) - 7 (mod 17)
y5 = -39 - 7 (mod 17)
y5 = -46 (mod 17)
y5 = 6

So, 5P = (15, 6)

Therefore, the coordinates of the point Q = 5P are (15, 6).
